Dear Ms. Black-Moore:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 08/19/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(a) All of the following child characteristics:
(iii) Height and weight.
(vi) Religious preference.
(iii) Two of eight placement records reviewed did not have updated height and
weight information for the child. Information is to be current in MiSACWIS.
(vi) One of eight placement records reviewed did not identify the child’s religious
preference.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless a
greater frequency is medically indicated:
(iii) A physical examination every 14 months.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed did not have a timely physical exam.
One child’s last physical exam was completed in 12/2019. The next physical exam
was due by 02/2020.
Another child’s last physical exam was completed in 06/2019. The next physical
exam was due by 08/2020.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(i) A statement from a parent or licensed medical authority
which indicates that immunizations are current or
contraindicated is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
(ii) A copy of a waiver addressed to the department of
community health signed by the parent stating immunizations
4

are not being administered due to religious, medical, or other
reasons is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations shall begin within 30
calendar days of placement.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed did not have a current immunization record.
One child’s immunization record indicates meningococcal conjugate was due
10/30/2019.
Another child’s immunization record indicates Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis
were due 07/2020.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 06/26/2019 renewal inspection

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
5

 DHHS Policy FOM 801 All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child’s current and
complete health information.
Eight of eight foster care files reviewed did not have updated quarterly medical
passports.
 DHHS Policy FOM 722-08 Social Service Supervisor is to sign and date the
approved updated service plans within 14 days of receipt.
Two of ten updated service plans reviewed were not signed by the social service
supervisor within 14 days of receipt.
One report was completed 07/05/2020 by the social service worker and signed and
dated 07/21/2020 by the social service supervisor.
Another report was completed 02/11/2020 by the social service worker and signed
and dated 03/03/2020 by the social service supervisor.
 DHHS Policy ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress Reports
Three of three adoption placement cases reviewed did not have quarterly adoption
progress reports.
 DHHS Policy Child Adoption Assessment is required annually if the child has
not been placed for adoption or sooner if there was a placement change or
significant event.
Three of three adoption placement cases reviewed did not have the required adoption
assessment.
 SRM 200 Security Awareness Training (SAT)
Department of Child Welfare Licensing analyst completed the SAT verification on
07/29/2020 and found three of eight employees with access to Criminal Record
History Information did not complete SAT training as required.
Employee One was hired 02/12/2018, last certified on 05/11/2018 and was not
recertified 05/11/2020.
Employee Two was hired 12/17/2019 and certification was completed 07/14/2020,
which is not within 6 months of hire.
Employee Three was hired 10/17/2019 and is not in the Learning Management
System. Certification is to be completed within 6 months of hire.
6

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Follow Communication Issuances for expectations due to Covid-19 pandemic.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Department of Child Welfare Licensing analyst completed home visits and interviews
in 06/2020. Safety alerts were not found.
There were zero incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were two incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
 2020C0628457
Foster parent was found in violation of R 400.9404 Behavior management.
She used her hand and “popped” the child twice on his bottom when he had a
draw string bag tied to his neck. Foster parent resigned the agency’s
behavioral management policy.
 2020C0628408
Foster parents were found in violation of R 400.9201 Foster home
applicant/licensee qualifications and R 400.9404 Behavior management due
to the use of corporal discipline of hitting a child and forcing a child to stand
on one leg facing a wall. This foster home was closed as a refusal to renew.
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan is from their
06/2019 renewal inspection. Citations are resolved except for the repeat violations
noted in this inspection report.
7

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
